intro: Cyrtandra grayana var. nervosa, commonly known as the nervy cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or orange. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with prominent venation, which is a defining trait of the varietal name "nervosa." It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
